thread.title: Northeast Ohio law enforcement agencies receive Justice Department grant money - cleveland.com
thread.title_full: Northeast Ohio law enforcement agencies receive Justice Department grant money - cleveland.com

author: Sabrina Eaton, cleveland.com
title: Northeast Ohio law enforcement agencies receive Justice Department grant money - cleveland.com
text:
WASHINGTON, D. C. - The U.S. Department of Justice has awarded $2 million to Cuyahoga County and $500,000 to Medina County in grants they’ll use to develop and acquire equipment, technologies, and interoperable communications that help respond to and prevent crime, U.S. Sen. Sherrod Brown announced Thursday.
Brown’s office said the investments come from the Department of Justice’s COPS Technology and Equipment Program, which invests in projects that improve police effectiveness and the flow of information among law enforcement agencies, local government service providers, and the communities they serve.
